g.text: Begg test and Egger test were performed to observe publication
Forest plot and funnel plot were
drawn to visually observe differences among included studies.
The consent of ethics committee or institutional reviewboardwas not
required in the meta-analysis, because the study was a review article.
A total of 39 articles with 4492 breast cancer patients were
included. Medicine, Embase, Web of knowledge, and Chinese
National Knowledge Infrastructure (CNKI) databases were all
remained after repeated retrievals were excluded. Then, 312
articles were eliminated after title and abstract were read. Further,
53 literatures were removed because they were not related with the
2, DAPK, hMLH1, p14, and p15 genes hypermethylation.
Moreover, 41 articles were excluded since they had no enough data
to conduct a meta-analysis. Finally, 39 articles which compared the
2, DAPK, hMLH1, p14, and p15 genes
promoter hypermethylation in control group with those in case
studies were about DAPK gene promoter hypermethylation,
hMLH1 gene promoter hypermethylation were studied in 5
studies, 6 studies were about p14 gene promoter hypermethyla-
tion, and 4 studies were about p15 gene promoter hyper-
methylation. The included studies were mainly carried out in
Asians and Caucasians in the present meta-analysis. Figure 1
The NOS score of included studies was from 6 to 8 stars. The results
showed that studies of moderate or high quality were included in this
meta-analysis, which greatly improve the power of statistics.
3.3. Results of meta-analysis and trial sequential analysis
According to results of the meta-analysis, RAR
cantly associated with the risk of breast
Flow chart of included studies searching.
